citation.article-title: Salegentibacter catena sp. nov., isolated from sediment of the South China Sea, and emended description of the genus Salegentibacter.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Salegentibacter catena sp. nov.
Salegentibacter catena (ca.te′na. L. n. catena chain, referring to the fact that cells frequently occur in chains).
Cells are Gram-negative rods, 0.5–0.8×2–6 μm, frequently occurring in chains and producing appendages in older cultures.
Devoid of flagellar and gliding motilities.
Colonies on marine agar 2216 are saffron yellow, slimy, circular, convex and shiny, 3–5 mm in diameter after 5 days of incubation at 30 °C.
Growth occurs at 15–42 °C (optimum, 33 °C), at pH 6.5–9.0 (optimum, 7.5–8.2) and in 0.1–10 % NaCl (optimum, 1–4 %).
Arginine dihydrolase, urease and lecithinase are negative.
H2S is produced, but indole is not.
Aesculin, casein, gelatin, starch and Tween 20 are hydrolysed, but agar, DNA and carboxymethylcellulose are not.

Weak growth and acid formation occur with glucose, but not with sucrose, mannose, maltose, arabinose, lactose, rhamnose, melibiose, fucose, raffinose, xylose, adonitol, inositol, sorbitol, gluconate, malonate, galactose, malate, citrate, pyruvate, lactate, propionate, acetate, alanine or proline.

In API ZYM kits, activities of alkaline and acid phosphatases, esterase lipase (C8), leucine and valine arylamidases, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase are strong and activities of esterase (C4), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase and trypsin are weak.
Negative for activities of α-chymotrypsin, β-galactosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, α-mannosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.

Resistant to gentamicin (10 μg), neomycin (30 μg), polymyxin B (300 μg) and streptomycin (10 μg), but sensitive to ampicillin (10 μg), carbenicillin (100 μg), tetracycline (30 μg), vancomycin (30 μg), ciprofloxacin (5 μg), rifampicin (5 μg), norfloxacin (10 μg), chloramphenicol (30 μg), benzylpenicillin (10 μg), kanamycin (30 μg) and erythromycin (15 μg).
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 44.4 mol%.
The type strain is HY1T (=CGMCC 1.6101T=JCM 14015T), which was isolated from sediment of Xijiang oilfield in the South China Sea.
